messages.subject: Re: Re: Message for Casey,
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well...it s not like she wouldn t do that. ;-) I m being selfish here. We re moving soon, hopefully, and I don t think it could be accomplished before we
messages.messageBody:
>>Psssst, Casey. Why don't you write the show and explain everything to
>>them AND then tell them that your parents would be happy to sign a release
>>and waiver <g>>>

Well...it's not like she wouldn't do that. ;-) I'm being selfish here. We're
moving soon, hopefully, and I don't think it could be accomplished before we
go. And besides, what would be the point? Besides, I'm still working on
helping her develop her neighborhood library system for the kids on the
block (complete with story time). And oh yeah, she figured out something
else to do instead. She wants to trade lives with one of her friends for a
day, a la "A Walk In Your Shoes" on Noggin.

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Message for Casey,
messages.msgSnippet: Psssst, Casey.  Why don t you write the show and explain everything to them AND then tell them that your parents would be happy to sign a release and waiver
messages.messageBody:
Psssst, Casey. Why don't you write the show and explain everything to them
AND then tell them that your parents would be happy to sign a release and
waiver <g>

The short Dixie Chick did that and now she will be on the show sometime this
month!

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: "zenmomma *" <zenmomma@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, April 02, 2002 7:03 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Message for Casey,


>
>
> >>Hey, Casey, don't tell your mom but they will do kids rooms if you get
> >>your parents to do the work <g>>>
>
> Shhhhhh! Don't tell her that! :-o
>
> Actually, she knows that we could do it with adults involved. That's not
> what she wants. In true Casey fashion, she wants to do the Trading Spaces
> herself. She thinks age restrictions are totally bogus. Come to think of
it,
> Trading Spaces would have their hands full if they did let Casey on. There
> is NO way she would let some designer run the show. ;-) LOL!
>
> Life is good.
> ~Mary

messages.subject: Re: Message for Casey,
messages.msgSnippet: ... Shhhhhh! Don t tell her that! :-o Actually, she knows that we could do it with adults involved. That s not what she wants. In true Casey fashion, she wants
messages.messageBody:
>>Hey, Casey, don't tell your mom but they will do kids rooms if you get
>>your parents to do the work <g>>>

Shhhhhh! Don't tell her that! :-o

Actually, she knows that we could do it with adults involved. That's not
what she wants. In true Casey fashion, she wants to do the Trading Spaces
herself. She thinks age restrictions are totally bogus. Come to think of it,
Trading Spaces would have their hands full if they did let Casey on. There
is NO way she would let some designer run the show. ;-) LOL!

Life is good.
~Mary
